root.name: rotateZ()
root.description: Rotates an object around the Z axis the amount specified by the angle parameter. Angles should be specified in radians (values from 0 to PI*2) by default, but in degrees (values from 0 to 360) if the current angle mode is DEGREES. Objects are always rotated around their relative position to the origin and positive numbers rotate objects in a counterclockwise direction. Transformations apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function accumulates the effect. For example, calling rotateZ(PI/2) and then rotateZ(PI/2) is the same as rotateZ(PI). If rotateZ() is called within the loop(), the transformation is reset when the loop begins again.

parameter.label: angle
parameter.description: float: angle of rotation specified in radians
